poem:
**Lime Close**

So much depends  
upon  

a small street  
at 6:10,  
sirens  
in the wet air,  

a girl's name  
spoken low,  
and a boy  
in court—  
only his birth  
to offer.  

In the houses  
the kettles lift  
their thin steam.  
Privacy, they say.  
But grief  
spreads, plain,  
through the town.

The boy, who cannot be named because of his age, appeared at Bristol magistrates court on Wednesday charged with her murder. During a brief hearing, he spoke only to confirm his name, address and date of birth. He was remanded into youth detention accommodation before a hearing at Bristol crown court on Friday. The boy was arrested in nearby Worle a short time after the girl was found in Lime Close.
